Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed (fired greenish); added red and white bands above trace of possible white maeander band; below, part of two red and white pomegranates; exterior: procession to right (of first figure, only part of cloak remaining; of second, part of red and black cloak with vertical guilloche pattern and dotted hem).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0816) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl np 62 (Other Accession Number)
